sentence.text: Molecular genetic tests for episodic ataxia muscle organ development 2 (EA2) usually target only the specific calcium channel gene (CACNA1A) that is known to cause EA2.

Here we present a case of a proband with a complex episodic ataxias (EA)/seizure phenomuscle organ development with an EA-affected father; and an unaffected mother, all negative for CACNA1A gene mutations.
The negative regulation of fat cell differentiation was studied by whole-exome sequencing to identify candidate genes responsible for causing the complex EA/seizure phenotype.

entity.text: negative regulation of fat cell differentiation
